| A shoggoth:* can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim").
* can flow under doors.
* can [survive underwater](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious").
* has no head.
* is [acidic](/wiki/Acidic "Acidic") to eat.
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is neither male nor female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can pick up [magical items](/wiki/Magical_item "Magical item").
* appears only in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

- *For the monster in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and its variants, see [Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)").*

A **shoggoth**, b, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). The shoggoth is an [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") [blob](/wiki/Blob "Blob")-like monster that can pick up and collect items, favoring magic ones - it is also capable of [swimming](/wiki/Swimming "Swimming"), and can [follow](/wiki/Follow "Follow") [you](/wiki/You "You") to other levels if it is adjacent. As indicated by the encyclopedia entry for that monster, the [priest of Ghaunadaur](/wiki/Priest_of_Ghaunadaur "Priest of Ghaunadaur") is a shoggoth that has been called to serve Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded.

A shoggoth has two [touch](/index.php?title=Touch\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Touch (page does not exist)") attacks, a fairly-unique suction attack with a variety of effects, and a passive [acidic](/wiki/Acid "Acid") splash. Shoggoths also possess [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), [acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance"), and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance"). A tame shoggoth may turn [traitor](/wiki/Traitor "Traitor").

A shoggoth [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") is acidic to eat, but eating a shoggoth corpse or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 1⁄3 chance each of conveying cold resistance, poison resistance or shock resistance, and also cures [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Suction attack](#Suction_attack)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Shoggoths are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") and the [Neutral Quest](/wiki/Neutral_Quest_\(dNetHack\) "Neutral Quest (dNetHack)"). Randomly generated shoggoths are always created hostile.

A shoggoth may be one of the monsters generated within a [magic item vault](/wiki/Special_room_\(dNetHack\)#Magic_item_vault "Special room (dNetHack)").

Several shoggoths are generated at level creation in the Lost Cities of the lower Neutral Quest - on the last floor, R'lyeh, two of the temple complexes contain three shoggoths each. A shoggoth will appear within one of the rooms in [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")'s lair if his dwelling appears as [the third Abyss level](/wiki/User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine_Flats#Demogorgon.27s_palace "User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats").

## Strategy

Shoggoths are probably best avoided if at all possible, due to their ability to suck away your armor and weapons, and can even instantly kill you if they managed to pull off your helmet during a previous round. If one is spotted, your best choice may be to flee immediately.

### Suction attack

Each suction effect is rolled for and applied independently, so more than one can occur with the same hit unless otherwise specified. The rolls for each effects occur in the following order:

1. If your HP is less than 100, you have a [head](/wiki/Head "Head"), and you are not wearing a helmet, there is a 1⁄20 chance of your head being sucked off, instantly killing you. No further effects will be applied on that turn if this occurs.
2. There is a 1⁄10 chance of [both your legs being badly injured](/wiki/Wounded_legs "Wounded legs").
3. There is a 3⁄20 chance of your [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") being sucked out of your grasp, which can be prevented with high [strength](/wiki/Strength "Strength").
4. There is a 1⁄10 chance of your [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots") being sucked off your feet, unless they have the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of [buckled boots](/wiki/Buckled_boots "Buckled boots").
5. There is a 3⁄20 chance of your [gloves](/wiki/Gloves "Gloves") being sucked off your hands, unless you are wielding a weapon - high strength can block this completely.
6. There is a 7⁄100 chance of your [shield](/wiki/Shield "Shield") being sucked out of your grasp - high strength can help prevent this.
7. There is a 1⁄4 chance of your [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet") being sucked off of your head.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Shoggoth](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shoggoth "wikipedia:Shoggoth")***

The shoggoth is a creature that originates from the works of [H.P. Lovecraft](/wiki/H.P._Lovecraft "H.P. Lovecraft"), where they appear as massive and occasionally intelligent amoeboid creatures made out of iridescent black slime, with multiple eyes floating on the surface. An average shoggoth measures 4.5 meters (15 feet) across while spherical, though they can become much larger.

## Encyclopedia entry

"... in the place of utter blasphemy, the unholy pit where  
the black realm begins and the watcher guards the gate -  
I saw a shoggoth - it changed shape ..."

\[ The Thing on the Doorstep, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

  


It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway  
train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly  
self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and  
un-forming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-  
filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic  
penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and  
its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter. Still came  
that eldritch, mocking cry -- "Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!" and at  
last we remembered that the demoniac Shoggoths - given life,  
thought, and plastic organ patterns solely by the Old Ones ...

\[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Shoggoth (dNetHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
b shoggoth
Difficulty 25
Attacks Touch 1d12 acid, Touch 1d12 sticky, Bearhug 2d12 suction, Passive 2d12 acid
b shoggoth
Difficulty 25
Attacks

Touch 1d12 acid, Touch 1d12 sticky, Bearhug 2d12 suction, Passive 2d12 acid

Base level 20
Base experience 743
Speed 15
Base AC 10
Base MR 0
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 2 (Quite rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 4500
Nutritional value 1000
Size huge
Resistances cold, shock, poison, acid, petrification
Resistances conveyed cold, shock, poison

A shoggoth:

  • can swim.
  • can flow under doors.
  • can survive underwater.
  • has no head.
  • is acidic to eat.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can pick up magical items.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • may turn against you when tame.

For the monster in SLASH'EM and its variants, see Shoggoth (SLASH'EM).

A shoggoth, b, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. The shoggoth is an omnivorous blob-like monster that can pick up and collect items, favoring magic ones - it is also capable of swimming, and can follow you to other levels if it is adjacent. As indicated by the encyclopedia entry for that monster, the priest of Ghaunadaur is a shoggoth that has been called to serve Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded.

A shoggoth has two touch attacks, a fairly-unique suction attack with a variety of effects, and a passive acidic splash. Shoggoths also possess cold resistance, poison resistance, shock resistance, acid resistance, and stoning resistance. A tame shoggoth may turn traitor.

A shoggoth corpse is acidic to eat, but eating a shoggoth corpse or tin has a 1⁄3 chance each of conveying cold resistance, poison resistance or shock resistance, and also cures stoning.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
    • 2.1 Suction attack
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Shoggoths are only randomly generated in Gehennom and the Neutral Quest. Randomly generated shoggoths are always created hostile.

A shoggoth may be one of the monsters generated within a magic item vault.

Several shoggoths are generated at level creation in the Lost Cities of the lower Neutral Quest - on the last floor, R'lyeh, two of the temple complexes contain three shoggoths each. A shoggoth will appear within one of the rooms in Demogorgon's lair if his dwelling appears as the third Abyss level.

Strategy

Shoggoths are probably best avoided if at all possible, due to their ability to suck away your armor and weapons, and can even instantly kill you if they managed to pull off your helmet during a previous round. If one is spotted, your best choice may be to flee immediately.

Suction attack

Each suction effect is rolled for and applied independently, so more than one can occur with the same hit unless otherwise specified. The rolls for each effects occur in the following order:

  1. If your HP is less than 100, you have a head, and you are not wearing a helmet, there is a 1⁄20 chance of your head being sucked off, instantly killing you. No further effects will be applied on that turn if this occurs.
  2. There is a 1⁄10 chance of both your legs being badly injured.
  3. There is a 3⁄20 chance of your weapon being sucked out of your grasp, which can be prevented with high strength.
  4. There is a 1⁄10 chance of your boots being sucked off your feet, unless they have the randomized appearance of buckled boots.
  5. There is a 3⁄20 chance of your gloves being sucked off your hands, unless you are wielding a weapon - high strength can block this completely.
  6. There is a 7⁄100 chance of your shield being sucked out of your grasp - high strength can help prevent this.
  7. There is a 1⁄4 chance of your helmet being sucked off of your head.

Origin

Wikipedia has an article about:
Shoggoth

The shoggoth is a creature that originates from the works of H.P. Lovecraft, where they appear as massive and occasionally intelligent amoeboid creatures made out of iridescent black slime, with multiple eyes floating on the surface. An average shoggoth measures 4.5 meters (15 feet) across while spherical, though they can become much larger.

Encyclopedia entry

"... in the place of utter blasphemy, the unholy pit where
the black realm begins and the watcher guards the gate -
I saw a shoggoth - it changed shape ..."

[ The Thing on the Doorstep, by H.P. Lovecraft ]


It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway
train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly
self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and
un-forming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-
filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic
penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and
its kind had swept so evilly free of all litter. Still came
that eldritch, mocking cry -- "Tekeli-li! Tekeli-li!" and at
last we remembered that the demoniac Shoggoths - given life,
thought, and plastic organ patterns solely by the Old Ones ...

[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]

{{for|the monster in [[SLASH'EM]] and its variants|Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)}}

A '''shoggoth''', {{brightgreen|b}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. The shoggoth is an [[omnivorous]] [[blob]]-like monster that can pick up and collect items, favoring magic ones - it is also capable of [[swimming]], and can [[follow]] [[you]] to other levels if it is adjacent.  As indicated by the encyclopedia entry for that monster, the [[priest of Ghaunadaur]] is a shoggoth that has been called to serve Ghaunadaur, a god of fallen stars, slime, outcasts, and the discarded.

A shoggoth has two [[touch]] attacks, a fairly-unique suction attack with a variety of effects, and a passive [[acid]]ic splash. Shoggoths also possess [[cold resistance]], [[poison resistance]], [[shock resistance]], [[acid resistance]], and [[stoning resistance]]. A tame shoggoth may turn [[traitor]].

A shoggoth [[corpse]] is acidic to eat, but eating a shoggoth corpse or [[tin]] has a {{frac|3}} chance each of conveying cold resistance, poison resistance or shock resistance, and also cures [[stoning]].

==Generation==
Shoggoths are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]] and the [[Neutral Quest (dNetHack)|Neutral Quest]]. Randomly generated shoggoths are always created hostile.

A shoggoth may be one of the monsters generated within a [[Special room (dNetHack)#Magic item vault|magic item vault]].

Several shoggoths are generated at level creation in the Lost Cities of the lower Neutral Quest - on the last floor, R'lyeh, two of the temple complexes contain three shoggoths each. A shoggoth will appear within one of the rooms in [[Demogorgon]]'s lair if his dwelling appears as [[User:Chris/dNetHack/Branches/Brine Flats#Demogorgon's palace|the third Abyss level]].

==Strategy==
Shoggoths are probably best avoided if at all possible, due to their ability to suck away your armor and weapons, and can even instantly kill you if they managed to pull off your helmet during a previous round. If one is spotted, your best choice may be to flee immediately.  

===Suction attack===
Each suction effect is rolled for and applied independently, so more than one can occur with the same hit unless otherwise specified. The rolls for each effects occur in the following order:

# If your HP is less than 100, you have a [[head]], and you are not wearing a helmet, there is a {{frac|20}} chance of your head being sucked off, instantly killing you. No further effects will be applied on that turn if this occurs.
# There is a {{frac|10}} chance of [[Wounded legs|both your legs being badly injured]].
# There is a {{frac|3|20}} chance of your [[weapon]] being sucked out of your grasp, which can be prevented with high [[strength]].
# There is a {{frac|10}} chance of your [[boots]] being sucked off your feet, unless they have the [[randomized appearance]] of [[buckled boots]].
# There is a {{frac|3|20}} chance of your [[gloves]] being sucked off your hands, unless you are wielding a weapon - high strength can block this completely.
# There is a {{frac|7|100}} chance of your [[shield]] being sucked out of your grasp - high strength can help prevent this.
# There is a {{frac|4}} chance of your [[helmet]] being sucked off of your head.

==Origin==
{{wikipedia|Shoggoth}}
The shoggoth is a creature that originates from the works of [[H.P. Lovecraft]], where they appear as massive and occasionally intelligent amoeboid creatures made out of iridescent black slime, with multiple eyes floating on the surface. An average shoggoth measures 4.5 meters (15 feet) across while spherical, though they can become much larger.

==Encyclopedia entry==

"... in the place of utter blasphemy, the unholy pit where
the black realm begins and the watcher guards the gate -
I saw a shoggoth - it changed shape ..."
{{right-align|[ The Thing on the Doorstep, by H.P. Lovecraft ]}}

It was a terrible, indescribable thing vaster than any subway
train -- a shapeless congeries of protoplasmic bubbles, faintly
self-luminous, and with myriads of temporary eyes forming and
un-forming as pustules of greenish light all over the tunnel-
filling front that bore down upon us, crushing the frantic
penguins and slithering over the glistening floor that it and

last we remembered that the demoniac Shoggoths - given life, 
thought, and plastic organ patterns solely by the Old Ones ...
{{right-align|[ At the Mountains of Madness, by H.P. Lovecraft ]}}
